comments.body: We need to mention that the eigenvalues and eigenvectors for a non-Hermitian matrix in general are complex, and the eigenvectors are not guaranteed to be linearly independent (The matrix may be "defective", i.e. have lower geometric than algebraic multiplicity). Furthermore, mention that what we compute here are the _right_ eigenvectors. Maybe add a reference to R. A. Horn & C. R. Johnson, "Matrix Analysis", Chapter 1.
